page.title: 12Shalford Church Fete
page.content: With the exception of two members of the P.C.C.,{St Andrew's {Church Shalford,}relies on lay members to organise this event, at the{Village {Hall.}Annually, busy parishioners manage to produce an interesting and enjoyable event. On the playing field, the vaulting horse competes for custom with pony rides, bowling, cycling and fishing, while the fortune teller deals with her expectant queue (all ladies). The cake stall could be compared to the finest professional patisserie with the sweet smell of home baking. The book stall is popular. All ages find "treasures". Items from the White Elephant stall find new homes. There are queues for tombola and cream teas. After the raffle is drawn we go home, giving thanks for a fine day.
